thread.title: Everton v Manchester United, Chelsea v Aston Villa: Barclays Premier League - Live
thread.title_full: Everton v Manchester United, Chelsea v Aston Villa: Barclays Premier League - Live

title: Everton v Manchester United, Chelsea v Aston Villa: Barclays Premier League - Live
text:
October 17, 2015 13:45 BST Updated 6 min ago Now 13:48 
TEAM NEWS - Everton: Things are also looking better for Roberto Martinez, who can welcome Seamus Coleman and John Stones back into his starting XI while Tom Cleverley and Steven Pienaar are also back in contention. Now 13:47 
TEAM NEWS - Manchester United: United come back from the international break with no major injury concerns. Wayne Rooney and Michael Carrick are fit after missing England's final two Euro 2016 qualifiers, while Ander Herrera and Marcos Rojo are both available after overcoming knocks. Bastian Schweinsteiger missed Germany's two games last week, but Louis van Gaal did not mention the World Cup-winning captain when reeling off his list of potential problems. Ashley Young is ruled out however after picking up a knee injury in training while Paddy McNair is also unavailable. 1 hr 12:43 
1-0. 2-0. 3-0. In their last three meetings at Goodison Park, Everton have inflicted more and more damage on Manchester United who haven't won on the blue half of Merseyside since 2011. 
On each of those occasions, the away side were thoroughly outclassed. After being torn apart by Arsenal in their last game, United desperately need to break that hoodoo, but have Everton got their number? 
That's just one of six 3pm kick offs on a packed Saturday afternoon where Chelsea will attempt to halt their slide at home to Aston Villa. Manchester City, without David Silva and Sergio Aguero welcome Bournemouth to the Etihad Stadium. 
Crystal Palace v West Ham Everton v Manchester United
